"Hey, thanks for showing up.": "...You know, I always hated my Dad's training."
"\"You're still not giving me 100%. You won't become a full-fledged ARKS like that,\" he'd tell me."
"I mean, I'm HIS daughter, you know? I should be stronger than any ARKS out there."
"So I've been asking myself \"Why didn't he let me fight with him?\" a lot lately."
"...In that last battle, I finally understood why."
"When Bruder asked me to close my eyes, the faces of everyone from Aerio Town came to mind."
"Before, I never really thought about \"why\" I fought. I just wanted to be an ARKS like my Dad, you know?"
"That's all it was... and my Dad could tell. He saw right through me."
"Only now that he's gone am I too late to realize it."
"That I had absolutely no idea what it even meant to fight."
"Back there, when the Nagrus turned red, my feet just... stopped. I froze up."
"And then, I became afraid."
"...Not afraid to fight, no..."
"Afraid that, what if all I'm doing is holding you two back?"
"...So then... I just..."
"...Aina."
"Did you forget the promise we made in front of Crawford?"
"What?"
"\"I'll help.\", I said. I was saying that to you, you know."
"...Manon."
"Aren't we going to defeat Dark Falz, together?"
"Manon... Thank you."
"I want to become stronger. Strong enough to fight DOLLS like you two."
"And I'll need you both to help me. I want us to fight... together."
"Yeah, you know, that's kind of always been the plan."
"Thank you... both of you... Thank you."
